description:
Example :

nova absolute-limits --tenant test_fil
+-------------------------+-------+
| Name                    | Value |
+-------------------------+-------+
| maxServerMeta           | 128   |
| maxPersonality          | 5     |
| maxImageMeta            | 128   |
| maxPersonalitySize      | 10240 |
| maxTotalRAMSize         | 8192  |
| maxSecurityGroupRules   | 20    |
| maxTotalKeypairs        | 4     |
| totalRAMUsed            | 2048  |
| maxSecurityGroups       | 10    |
| totalFloatingIpsUsed    | 0     |
| totalInstancesUsed      | 1     |
| totalSecurityGroupsUsed | 1     |
| maxTotalFloatingIps     | 4     |
| maxTotalInstances       | 4     |
| totalCoresUsed          | 1     |
| maxTotalCores           | 4     |
+-------------------------+-------+

nova --debug quota-delete --tenant test_fil
REQ: curl -i 'http://controller1:8774/v2/admin/os-quota-sets/test_fil' -X DELETE -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: admin" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: ...

nova absolute-limits --tenant test_fil
+-------------------------+-------+
| Name                    | Value |
+-------------------------+-------+
| maxServerMeta           | 128   |
| maxPersonality          | 5     |
| maxImageMeta            | 128   |
| maxPersonalitySize      | 10240 |
| maxTotalRAMSize         | 8192  |
| maxSecurityGroupRules   | 20    |
| maxTotalKeypairs        | 4     |
| totalRAMUsed            | 0     |
| maxSecurityGroups       | 10    |
| totalFloatingIpsUsed    | 0     |
| totalInstancesUsed      | 0     |
| totalSecurityGroupsUsed | 0     |
| maxTotalFloatingIps     | 4     |
| maxTotalInstances       | 4     |
| totalCoresUsed          | 0     |
| maxTotalCores           | 4     |
+-------------------------+-------+
title: Icehouse nova quota-delete also erase currently used absolute limits

comments.content:
Example :

nova absolute-limits --tenant test_fil
+-------------------------+-------+
| Name                    | Value |
+-------------------------+-------+
| maxServerMeta           | 128   |
| maxPersonality          | 5     |
| maxImageMeta            | 128   |
| maxPersonalitySize      | 10240 |
| maxTotalRAMSize         | 8192  |
| maxSecurityGroupRules   | 20    |
| maxTotalKeypairs        | 4     |
| totalRAMUsed            | 2048  |
| maxSecurityGroups       | 10    |
| totalFloatingIpsUsed    | 0     |
| totalInstancesUsed      | 1     |
| totalSecurityGroupsUsed | 1     |
| maxTotalFloatingIps     | 4     |

REQ: curl -i 'http://controller1:8774/v2/admin/os-quota-sets/test_fil' -X DELETE -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: admin" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: ...

| totalRAMUsed            | 0     |

| totalInstancesUsed      | 0     |

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gtrannecy

comments.content: Can you add more detail to this bug report. What is the issue and what is the expected behavior.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content:
The "nova quota-delete" command should delete quota for a tenant/user so their quota will revert back to default.
But the currently used resources, like totalInstancesUsed, are reset to 0.

If I launch a new instance, *Used parameters revert back to correct values.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gtrannecy

comments.content: Unfortunately icehouse isn't supported any more. Could you confirm if this problem still occurs with Juno?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mikal

comments.content: [Expired for OpenStack Compute (nova) because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~janitor
